Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant with water and show it is healthy (green leaves, standing upright).
The student can draw a plant without water and show it is not healthy (wilted leaves, drooping).
The student can include sunlight in the drawing to show that plants also need light to live and grow.
The student can compare and identify the difference between the two plants (with water vs. without water).
The student can show that all animals, including humans, need water by drawing animals drinking water.
